de.upb.t2t.model

Class PunctuationCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.upb.t2t.model.PunctuationCharacter

  • public class PunctuationCharacter
extends java.lang.Object
    A rather static class that contains a list of all punctuation characters that have been parsed from the database on startup. A PunctuationCharacter consists of the actual char primitive (e.g. '.', ':', '?', ...) and a delimiter mode. The latter indicates, which type of notational bar ('|' vs. '||') to use should the character happen to be transcribed.
    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)

    • Field Detail

      • KNOWN_PUNCTUATION_CHARACTERS

        private static PunctuationCharacter[] KNOWN_PUNCTUATION_CHARACTERS
        An array of all PunctuationCharacters parsed from the database on startup.

      • character

        private char character
        The PunctuationCharacter's actual character value.

      • delimiterMode

        private int delimiterMode
        The punctuation character's delimiter mode. A value of 0 indicates that no notational bar is required when transcribing this character, a 1 signifies a single ("|"), and a 2 a double bar ("||").

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static PunctuationCharacter[] values()
        A static getter imitating the way enumeration values can be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the array containing all parsed punctuation characters.

      • isPunctuationCharacter

        public static boolean isPunctuationCharacter(char character)
        A convenience getter that will check whether or not the given character has a corresponding PunctuationCharacter object. Contrary to getPunctChar(char), no NoSuchElementException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        character - the character to check.
        Returns:
        true if there is a corresponding PunctuationCharacter object; false otherwise.

      • isPunctuationCharacter

        public static boolean isPunctuationCharacter(java.lang.String character)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                             java.util.NoSuchElementException
        A convenience getter that will check whether or not the given character has a corresponding PunctuationCharacter object. Contrary to getPunctChar(String), no NoSuchElementException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        character - a String of length 1 containing the character to check.
        Returns:
        true if there is a corresponding punctuation character object; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter String was no of length 1.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException

      • getPunctChar

        public static PunctuationCharacter getPunctChar(char character)
                                         throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        A convenience getter that will return PunctuationCharacter for the given char.
        Parameters:
        character - the character to look up.
        Returns:
        the corresponding PunctuationCharacter object.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there is no stored PunctuationCharacter object.

      • getPunctChar

        public static PunctuationCharacter getPunctChar(java.lang.String character)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                java.util.NoSuchElementException
        A convenience getter that will return PunctuationCharacter for the given char.
        Parameters:
        character - a String of length 1 containing the character to look up.
        Returns:
        the corresponding PunctuationCharacter object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given String was not of length 1.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there is no stored PunctuationCharacter object.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(char character)
        A convenience function used to check whether this instance's character attribute matches the given char. Please note that this function does not override Object.equals(Object). Therefore, calling Object.equals(Object) may lead to different results.
        Parameters:
        character - the char to compare this object against.
        Returns:
        true if character equals the parameter.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(PunctuationCharacter punctChar)
        A convenience function used to compare two instances of this class. Returns true if the two objects' character attributes match. Please note that this function does not override Object.equals(Object). Therefore, calling Object.equals(Object) may lead to different results.
        Parameters:
        punctChar - the PunctuationCharacter to compare this object against.
        Returns:
        true if the character attributes match.
